intro: Cacalia auriculata var. praetermissa, commonly known as the slender bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to the western United States. It features slender, hairy stems that bear clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of blue to violet. The leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and full to partial sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or dry landscapes. This variety is notable for its delicate appearance and adaptability to arid environments.
